plays.name: 4-2-5 Cover 1
plays.offensiveFormation: 2x2 Spread (2 WR left, 2 WR right, 1 RB)
plays.offensivePlay: Four verticals, mesh, or zone read
plays.note: CBs and Nickel play man coverage. FS deep middle. Mike and Will cover RB/TE. DL responsible for gap integrity.

plays.name: 4-2-5 Cover 2
plays.offensivePlay: Smash, Stick, 4 Verticals, Bubble/Tunnel Screens, and Mesh
plays.note: CBs jam and sink to flats (cloud technique). FS and SS play deep halves. Mike drops to the middle hook zone, relating to #3 WR. Will and Nickel drop to their hook/curl zones, relating to the number 2 WR to their side.

plays.name: 4-2-5 Cover 4
plays.offensivePlay: Smash, Stick, 4 Verticals, Bubble/Tunnel Screens, and Mesh
plays.note: Safeties and corners play deep quarters. Mike drops to the middle hook off of #3 WR. Will drops to the curl/flat to weak side, off of final #2 to his side. Nickel covers curl/flat to strong side of field. DL responsible for gap integrity.

plays.name: Cover 1 Badger
plays.offensivePlay: Smash, Stick, 4 Verticals, Bubble/Tunnel Screens, and Mesh
plays.blitz: LB blitz B-Gap, whoever is aligned to the side of the RB.
plays.note: Free Safety plays the post. All other underneath defenders are in man coverage. The blitzing LB goes through the B-Gap, the non-blitzing LB plays spy technique on the QB.

plays.name: Nipsey 2 Trap
plays.offensivePlay: Smash, Stick, 4 Verticals, Bubble/Tunnel Screens, and Mesh
plays.note: Strong Safety and Boundary Corner play deep halves in zone coverage. Field Corner plays zone trap technique (pretends to play deep zone (like Cover 3 or Quarters) but actually traps short, in-breaking routes, forcing them to the outside where safeties help). Mike and Will show mugged up in both A-Gaps and then drop to their curl zone when ball is snapped.

plays.name: Waylon 3 Fire
plays.offensivePlay: Smash, Stick, 4 Verticals, Bubble/Tunnel Screens, and Mesh
plays.note: Will linebacker blitzes the B-Gap to the weak side. Both corners and strong safety drop the deep thirds in coverage. Free Safety rolls down to replace the blitzer in coverage, responsible for the weak flat zone. Mike drops to the middle hook, relating to the #3 WR. Nickel drops to the field flat, relating to the final #2 WR.
keyReads: zone eyes for all other off the ball defenders
